title: League Gala Event

replies.body: Such a fun story. Really enjoyed it!

_Few things-enjoyed the story, it was a short, fun, quick read. _

**+** Draven was very in character. You portrayed him wonderfully, and made the other champs shine, too.

**+ **Featuring multiple champions gives your readers a little something to enjoy, whether they're an Ahri one trick or #gragasmain.

**+ **The story was still entertaining, even if there was not a major conflict. 

**+** It was very light and hilarious, which is a nice change for League of Legends.

**/** You did well adding extra characters. It makes it more believable that not only Janna and Draven would be covering the scene. The conversation between everyone got a little confusing though, as it was back and forth. You might slim the dialogue down, but be careful where you do this-the conversations between the characters were a lot of the humor!

**/ **Some things shouldn't be abbreviated, but as most things are dialogue based, you captured our English slang really well. Towards the end, for example, saying "30 minutes" might have flowed better.

**-** Make sure you watch your grammar. Little things, like a missed apostrophe, can make a big difference.

**- **The actions and dialogue were sort of hard to differentiate between. Try using italics for your actions in between, since this is mostly script based, or even parentheses. Check out some plays to find out how they stylize their writing.

_I hope these tips helped. That's just the advice I can give. I hope it's relevant, and again, great piece! It really brightened my mood! I know it's already like, way past time to edit it and all, but I thought I'd still give pointers. Congrats on getting featured with it!_
{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}
